thread.title: Burton Smith Lost a Supercomputing Race but Won Respect and Influence

author: James R. Hagerty
title: Burton Smith Lost a Supercomputing Race but Won Respect and Influence
text:
In the late 1980s, Burton Smith vowed to build the world’s fastest computer. By the time his Tera MTA machine surfaced nearly a decade later, though, computer technology and customer preferences had moved on.
Remarkably, that failure didn’t dim his standing in the fraternity of computer architects. He remains celebrated as a pioneer in multi-threading... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
